Deprecated API

Contents
  • Deprecated Classes
  • Deprecated Methods
Deprecated Classes
js.JSConfirmDialogWithCheckbox
          JSConfirmDialogWithCheckbox has been deprecated because it's much easier and looks much nicer if you use JOptionPane. It turns out that the message parameter of JOptionPane.showMessageDialog can take an array of objects, which you can use to pass a String as the message and a JCheckBox together. 
js.JSTextFileReader
          JSTextFileReader has been deprecated in favour of the more fully-featured JSTextFileUtility, which supports writing to a file as well as reading from it. This class will be removed completely in JSLibrary 1.3.3. 
 

Deprecated Methods
js.JSTable.centerAllColumns()
          - This method has been replaced with a more powerful method, setColumnAlignment, which allows not only center alignment but also right alignment as well. This method will be removed completely in version 1.2.3 (or the third new version of JSTable). 
js.JSTable.centerColumn(int)
          - This method has been replaced with a more powerful method, setColumnAlignment, which allows not only center alignment but also right alignment as well. This method will be removed completely in version 1.2.3 (or the third new version of JSTable). 
js.JSTable.centerHeaders()
          - This method has been replaced with a more powerful method, setHeaderAlignment, which allows not only center alignment but also right alignment as well. This method will be removed completely in version 1.2.3 (or the third new version of JSTable). 
js.JSUtil.checkForJSLibraryUpdate()
          The method this uses to check for an update (using http://joshsunshine.me.uk) is going away soon, so get ready to stop using this. The JSLibrary is hosted on GitHub now at http://github.com/jobbogamer/JSLibrary so changelogs and version histories will be readily available there. 
js.JSTable.makeDialog()
          This method does not provide adequate support for using a modal dialog and waiting for user input after being displayed. It is recommended that you use a JSTableDialog instead of a regular JSTable. 
js.JSTable.makeDialog(JPanel, JPanel)
          This method does not provide adequate support for using a modal dialog and waiting for user input after being displayed. It is recommended that you use a JSTableDialog instead of a regular JSTable.
